channel.title: PHP Printer
channel.description: Hi guys, what I am trying to do is make a regulated printing system with accounts for my family, where each account has a name, a password and credit(they pay $5 and they get 500 print credits). I have got the accounts and automated topup to work, but how do I get my server to print the files to the printer hooked up on it? All of the php printer extensions that I have found so far are only for php 4 but I have 5.3.... Does anyone have a good idea?

item.title: PHP Printer
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

Install CUPS but use PHP to save the priting content to a file, then execute a CUPS command from PHP to print the file.

Read full topic

item.title: PHP Printer
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

well, the printer I have, it takes about 30 secs to warm up, but then it takes like 2 mins to change the image on the toner when it is detailed before it prints.

Read full topic

item.title: PHP Printer
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

eczema3:

Laser printers generally do take a while to print, if they haven’t been used for a while.

They just take a while to warm up, then they print really, really fast.

Read full topic

item.title: PHP Printer
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

Laser printers generally do take a while to print, if they haven’t been used for a while.

item.title: PHP Printer
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

… That was the first thing I tried… I ended up just using commandline print commands like print /d:printer file and pdfprint /l printer file and htmlprint etc… It seems to work fine, except the laser printer takes so long to print.

Read full topic

item.title: PHP Printer
item.dc:creator: @Starting_up Starting up ...
item.description:
@Starting_up wrote:

http://us3.php.net/manual/en/book.printer.php

Read full topic

item.title: PHP Printer
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:4, topic:301303”]Really though, CUPS is the way to go. Why re-invent the wheel? You can set up all of those same permissions and accounts and such with CUPS, with the added benefit being they can just hit the print button like any other printer. No need to write your own PHP interface to handle this.

Also, can’t you use PHP4 code/libraries with PHP5? I figured you could, but maybe not.[/quote]maybe he doesnt run unix, who knows

anyways, i dont know much about available php external libraries to handle this, but in the worst case, use the php library that provides an interface to java code, and print through there. although, this is a very, very nasty way of doing it as you can see

i would simply use jsp, but ive seen that this isnt a preferred language among this forum

edit: http://java.sun.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/awt/Desktop.html#print(java.io.File)

Read full topic

item.title: PHP Printer
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Really though, CUPS is the way to go. Why re-invent the wheel? You can set up all of those same permissions and accounts and such with CUPS, with the added benefit being they can just hit the print button like any other printer. No need to write your own PHP interface to handle this.

Also, can’t you use PHP4 code/libraries with PHP5? I figured you could, but maybe not.

Read full topic

item.title: PHP Printer
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

Cheese_Police:

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CUPS

That is not what I want, I want the entire thing to be done with php, as if it was php 4…

Read full topic
